title: TaskFlow KMP Architecture Quiz
description: Test your understanding of the TaskFlow capstone architecture, technology choices, and KMP project structure.

questions.text: In the TaskFlow capstone, which module contains the @Serializable data classes shared between the server and client?
options: server/ -- the server generates the classes and the client copies them
composeApp/ -- the UI module owns the data models
shared/ -- commonMain source set compiles to all targets
Each module defines its own copy of the models
questions.explanation: The shared/ module's commonMain source set contains @Serializable data classes (Task, User, DTOs) that compile to JVM (server), Android, and Desktop targets. This guarantees the server and client use identical types with no mapping code.

questions.text: Why does TaskFlow use H2 instead of PostgreSQL for the server database?
options: H2 is faster than PostgreSQL for all workloads
H2 is an embedded JVM database requiring zero setup -- no Docker or external services needed
PostgreSQL does not work with Exposed ORM
H2 supports multiplatform compilation to Android and iOS
questions.explanation: H2 runs as an embedded JVM database. It creates tables in memory (or a local file) automatically when the Ktor server starts. This eliminates the need to install PostgreSQL, run Docker, or configure cloud databases -- making the capstone accessible to all students.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'synced' column in the SQLDelight TaskEntity table?
options: It stores the server-side primary key for the task
It tracks whether a local change has been pushed to the server, enabling offline-first behavior
It indicates whether the task is visible in the UI
It records the timestamp of the last synchronization
questions.explanation: The synced column (INTEGER, 0 or 1) tracks whether local changes have been pushed to the server. When the user creates or updates a task offline, synced is set to 0. The SyncManager queries selectUnsynced to find these records and pushes them when connectivity returns.
